abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.description: increases the power of -type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as ).

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during .

abilities.name: Surge Surfer
abilities.description: doubles the bearer's Speed when  is active.

abilities.name: Unaware
abilities.description: Ignores any stat changes in the Pokémon.

abilities.name: Magic Guard
abilities.description: protects the Pokémon from indirect damage, including:It does not prevent damage from confusion, trapping moves (e.g. ) or .In  a Pokémon with  cannot be poisoned from , nor become fully immobile through paralysis (though the Speed drop still occurs).

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: When a Pokémon with  is hit by a Fire-type move, it does not deal damage but instead raises the power of the bearer's Fire-type moves by 50%. Subsequent hits do not raise the power even more, but the effect remains while the ability-bearer is in battle.

abilities.name: Snow Warning
abilities.description: creates a hailstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via  or  or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (, ,  or ) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to ,  lasts indefinitely upon activation.

abilities.name: Snow Cloak
abilities.description: raises ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a hail storm. It also gives immunity to damage by hail (if they are not already protected by being  type).If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a hail storm/blizzard, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Drought
abilities.description: creates harsh sunlight when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via  or  or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (, ,  or ) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to ,  lasts indefinitely upon activation.

abilities.name: Friend Guard
abilities.description: Reduces damage done to allies.

abilities.name: Cute Charm
abilities.description: If a Pokémon with  is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become infatuated. It will not infatuate Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon, nor those with the ability .Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being  each turn and unable to attack.If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of encountering a Pokémon of the opposite gender is .

abilities.name: Competitive
abilities.description: raises the ability-bearer's Special Attack by two stages when hit by a stat-lowering move.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

abilities.name: Frisk
abilities.description: The Pokémon can check a foe's held item.

abilities.name: Infiltrator
abilities.description: ignores the effects of ,  and . In other words, if the opponent has used Safeguard,  would still badly poison them.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like .

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like  or , or has an ability such as .Pokémon with  cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

abilities.name: Stench
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  has a 10% chance of causing the opponent to flinch when hit by a damaging move (provided the ability-bearer strikes first as usual). does not stack with the items  or , so an ability-bearer holding either item will keep the flinch chance at 10%.In ,  has no effect in battle.If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Damp
abilities.description: prevents all Pokémon on the field from using the moves  and . It also prevents damage (to the  Pokémon only) from the ability .

abilities.name: Dry Skin
abilities.description: causes several effects:

abilities.name: Effect Spore
abilities.description: Contact may poison or cause paralysis or sleep.

abilities.name: Compound Eyes
abilities.description: raises the ability-bearer's accuracy by 30%.In , this ability's name was formatted as .If a Pokémon with  is first in the party, Pokémon that can be holding items have that chance increase from 50% to 60% (for common items), 5% to 20% (for uncommon items) or 1% to 5% (for rare items).

abilities.name: Tinted Lens
abilities.description: Powers up “not very effective” moves.

abilities.name: Shield Dust
abilities.description: Blocks the added effects of attacks taken.

abilities.name: Wonder Skin
abilities.description: halves the accuracy of all status moves targeted at the ability-bearer.It does not affect  status moves like  or , nor does it affect the secondary conditions of attacking moves like .

abilities.name: Sand Veil
abilities.description: raises the ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a . It also gives immunity to sandstorm damage (if they are not already protected by being // type).If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a sandstorm, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Tangling Hair
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.

abilities.name: Sand Force
abilities.description: raises the power of ,  and  type moves by 30% during a .It also grants immunity to the sandstorm damage, if not already immune (currently this only applies to Shellos since all other Pokémon with the ability are already immune).

abilities.name: Arena Trap
abilities.description: prevents opponents from fleeing or switching out.  Pokémon are not affected.Raised Pokémon are any  types or those under the effects of ,  or . Full details in .If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Galvanize
abilities.description: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves and their power boosted.

abilities.name: Pastel Veil
abilities.description: prevents the Pokémon and its teammates from being poisoned. It also cures teammates of poisoning when it enters the battlefield.

abilities.name: Power of Alchemy
abilities.description: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

abilities.name: Neutralizing Gas
abilities.description: Neutralizes abilities of all Pokémon in battle.

abilities.name: Curious Medicine
abilities.description: Resets all stat changes upon entering battlefield.

abilities.name: Trace
abilities.description: The Pokémon copies a foe's Ability.

abilities.name: Quick Feet
abilities.description: raises the ability-bearer's Speed by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If paralyzed, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Speed.All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Wonder Guard
abilities.description: prevents damage from direct attacks unless they are super-effective. Shedinja is the only Pokémon to have this ability so this means that only , , ,  and  moves will have an effect.However, Pokémon protected by  are not immune to indirect attacks. Status-category moves still work and all end-of-turn damage will still incur, for example from poisoning, burns, sandstorms or hail. Entry hazards such as  or  will also damage Pokémon with  switching in. Attacks that do not take their type in account will also hit, such as ,  or . Since Shedinja only has 1 HP, any of the above damage will result in an instant knockout.

abilities.name: Normalize
abilities.description: causes all moves used by the Pokémon to become -type, and attacking moves increase in power by 20%.Normal-type Pokémon also gain  from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%).The following moves are not affected by : , , , , , , , , and damaging Z-Moves.The move  deals Normal/Flying type damage instead of Fighting/Flying.  remains super-effective against Water-types, but follows the Normal type chart against other types (e.g. neutral against Grass-types).In ,  did not increase damage (besides any usual boosts like ). All moves listed above except Struggle  affected by .

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves (, ,  or ).If  activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as ), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint. does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as ,  and .

abilities.name: Filter
abilities.description: reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%.For example, a Dark-type move used against a Psychic-type Pokémon with  would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×.

abilities.name: Heavy Metal
abilities.description: doubles the Pokémon's weight in battle. Increasing weight affects these moves:

abilities.name: Rock Head
abilities.description: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

abilities.name: Pure Power
abilities.description: Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat.

abilities.name: Liquid Ooze
abilities.description: Damages attackers using any draining move.

abilities.name: Magma Armor
abilities.description: prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen, for example from moves like .If a Pokémon with  (or  or ) and a  are amongst the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.

abilities.name: Marvel Scale
abilities.description: raises the ability-bearer's Defense by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep).All effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

abilities.name: Aerilate
abilities.description: causes all -type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become -type, and increase in power by 20%.Flying-type Pokémon also gain  from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%).In ,  increases affected moves' power by 30%.

abilities.name: Flower Gift
abilities.description: raises the Attack and Special Defense of all party Pokémon by 50% during harsh sunlight.

abilities.name: Flare Boost
abilities.description: Powers up special attacks when burned.

abilities.name: Speed Boost
abilities.description: Its Speed stat is gradually boosted.

abilities.name: Poison Heal
abilities.description: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned.

abilities.name: Forewarn
abilities.description: Determines what moves a foe has.

abilities.name: Super Luck
abilities.description: raises the ability-bearer's critical-hit ratio by one stage (for most moves this increases from a  chance to ).

abilities.name: Rivalry
abilities.description: Deals more damage to a Pokémon of same gender.

abilities.name: Big Pecks
abilities.description: prevents the ability-bearer's Defense stat from being lowered, for example via .

abilities.name: Sap Sipper
abilities.description: Boosts Attack when hit by a Grass-type move.

abilities.name: Motor Drive
abilities.description: Raises Speed if hit by an Electric-type move.

abilities.name: Lightning Rod
abilities.description: forces all single-target -type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move . The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. will activate for an Electric-type , but not Electric-type .The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the  from the moves  or .In ,  did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for .In , this ability's name was formatted as .

abilities.name: Sand Stream
abilities.description: creates a sandstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via  or  or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (, ,  or ) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to ,  lasts indefinitely upon activation.

abilities.name: Simple
abilities.description: The  ability doubles the number of stages of all stat changes. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.For example, using  would increase the Pokémon's attack by 4 stages instead of the usual 2. If  was targeted at a Pokémon with , its Defense would drop 2 stages instead of 1.The move  can change a Pokémon's ability to .In ,  doubles the effects of stat changes but does not increase the actual number of stages. Stat increases are capped at the same multiplier of ×4, as per the table below. However, the resulting effect is exactly the same as current games.

abilities.name: Gorilla Tactics
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move.

abilities.name: Zen Mode
abilities.description: changes the ability-bearer's form to  when their health falls below 50%.Currently it only applies to Darmanitan, whose form change makes it Fire/Psychic type and changes its stats around.

abilities.name: Mummy
abilities.description: Contact with this Pokémon spreads this Ability.

abilities.name: Solid Rock
abilities.description: reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%.For example, a Water-type move used against a Rock-type Pokémon with  would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×.

abilities.name: Swift Swim
abilities.description: doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during .

abilities.name: Defeatist
abilities.description: When the HP of a Pokémon with  falls below 50%, its Attack and Special Attack stats are halved.

abilities.name: Aftermath
abilities.description: If an attacker faints a Pokémon with  using a contact move, the attacker will lose  of their maximum HP.

abilities.name: Illusion
abilities.description: When a Pokémon with the  ability switches into battle, it takes the form of the Pokémon in last place (6th) of the player's party.  will not activate if the Pokémon in last place is the same species or is fainted.The effect is aesthetic only;  does not change the Pokémon's type or moves, so for example a -type move against a  disguised as  would still be super effective. Any direct attack (i.e. not entry hazards, weather conditions etc) will .

abilities.name: Shadow Tag
abilities.description: Prevents the foe from escaping.

abilities.name: Analytic
abilities.description: Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.

abilities.name: Battle Bond
abilities.description: causes Greninja to transform into Ash-Greninja when it KOs an opponent. also increases the power of Greninja's signature move .

abilities.name: Huge Power
abilities.description: Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat.

abilities.name: Gale Wings
abilities.description: Gives priority to Flying-type moves.

abilities.name: Grass Pelt
abilities.description: Boosts the Defense stat in Grassy Terrain.

abilities.name: No Guard
abilities.description: ensures that all attacks used by, and targeted at, the ability-bearer hit without fail.This includes moves used on a Pokémon in the  stages of the moves , ,  and .If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Stance Change
abilities.description: is exclusive to . When using a damage-dealing move,  switches to its Blade Forme. When using the move ,  switches to its Shield Forme.The form change occurs when the appropriate move is selected, regardless of whether the attack goes ahead (e.g. prevented by paralysis).

abilities.name: Suction Cups
abilities.description: prevents opponents forcing the ability-bearer to switch out or flee via the moves , , , or , or the item .If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of hooking a Pokémon during fishing increases.

abilities.name: Mega Launcher
abilities.description: increases the power of all  moves by 50%.  boosts the HP restored by 50%.The attacks classed as aura and pulse moves are shown below with their normal and boosted power:

abilities.name: Solar Power

abilities.description: causes all -type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become -type, and increase in power by 20%.Ice-type Pokémon also gain  from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%).In ,  increases affected moves' power by 30%.

abilities.name: Pixilate
abilities.description: causes all -type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become -type, and increase in power by 20%.Fairy-type Pokémon also gain  from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%).In ,  increases affected moves' power by 30%.

abilities.name: Hydration
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  will cure itself of any status conditions during rain, at the end of each turn. This includes self-inflicted conditions such as from using .

abilities.name: Long Reach
abilities.description: The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.

abilities.name: Intimidate

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.description: increases the power of -type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as ).

abilities.name: Liquid Voice
abilities.description: causes all  moves used by the Pokémon to become Water type. Water type Pokémon also gain  from those moves.It is the signature ability of the  evolution line, though other Pokémon may acquire  via certain abilities or moves such as .Attacks shown in  can be learned by , though the others can be called via moves such as .

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: increases the power of -type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as ).

abilities.name: Skill Link
abilities.description: causes multi-strike moves to always hit their maximum number of times. The moves affected are listed below; note that moves such as  that always strike the same number of times are not affected.In ,  is not affected by .

abilities.name: Battery
abilities.description: allows the Pokémon to raise the power of teammates' special moves.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.description: causes the Pokémon to be  (like -type Pokémon).Raised Pokémon are not affected by -type moves, ,  nor . Full details in .

abilities.description: prevents the bearer's Attack stat from being lowered by other Pokémon, through moves such as  or abilities such as .It does not prevent self-inflicted decreases, for example from .

abilities.name: Honey Gather
abilities.description: has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with  may pick up honey as a held item (if they are not already holding an item).

abilities.name: Merciless
abilities.description: The Pokémon's attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.

abilities.name: Water Bubble
abilities.description: reduces damage taken from Fire-type moves by 50%, and doubles the power of Water-type moves used by the ability-bearer. It also prevents the Pokémon from being burned.

abilities.name: Rain Dish
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  will recover  of its maximum HP during rain, after each turn.

abilities.description: has no effect in battle.If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Punk Rock

abilities.name: Minus

abilities.description: increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%.Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if  hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power.Moves like  that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by .

Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

abilities.description: The Pokémon ignores changes to opponents' evasiveness, its accuracy can't be lowered, and it can hit Ghost types with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with , the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on.In , bad poison is only passed on as regular poison.If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon, there is a 50% chance of each wild Pokémon encountered having the same nature.

abilities.name: Anticipation
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  will  upon entering battle, if an opponent has a move that is super-effective against it, or a One-Hit-KO move (, ,  or ). It only activates when the ability-bearer switches in, not when an opponent switches in. does not activate if the opponent has a move that varies in type, such as ,  or , even if those moves would be super-effective.

abilities.name: Opportunist
abilities.description: Copies stat boosts by the opponent.

abilities.name: Pickpocket
abilities.description: Steals an item when hit by another Pokémon.

abilities.name: Own Tempo
abilities.description: Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.

abilities.name: Gooey
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.

abilities.name: Zero to Hero
abilities.description: Transforms into its Hero Form when switching out.

abilities.name: Slow Start
abilities.description: Temporarily halves Attack and Speed.

abilities.name: Overcoat
abilities.description: makes the Pokémon immune to residual damage from weather conditions (specifically  and ).

abilities.name: Corrosion
abilities.description: allows the bearer to poison any Pokémon, including Steel and Poison types.

abilities.name: Toxic Debris
abilities.description: Scatters poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team when the Pokémon takes damage from physical moves.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with  will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again.Pokémon with  will also obtain an item thrown at them with  (if they are not already holding anything).In ,  has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with  has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item).Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

abilities.name: Fluffy
abilities.description: reduces damage from contact moves by 50%, but Fire-type moves do double damage. Fire-type moves that make contact do regular damage.

abilities.name: Sand Rush
abilities.description: doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during a .

abilities.name: Sheer Force
abilities.description: increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects. effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that  will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a  and uses an attack that activates , it will not receive the 10% damage from , but it gets boosts from both  and  (total of 69% base power increase). normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With , Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous  disadvantageous side-effect,  still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example,  may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with  using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.Here are the moves that increase in power under , listed alphabetically:

abilities.name: Slush Rush
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a hailstorm.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.description: reduces the damage taken from -type and -type moves by 50%.Interestingly, many Pokémon possessing this ability already take reduced damage from those types. A  or  with  would take  normal damage when hit by an Ice-type move.

abilities.name: Vital Spirit
abilities.description: prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move .If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

abilities.name: Cud Chew
abilities.description: causes the Pokémon to reuse an already consumed Berry at the end of the next turn.

abilities.name: Armor Tail
abilities.description: prevents the opponent from using any moves that have priority, such as .

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.description: doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items  and  from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance). does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio. normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with  it is boosted to a 40% chance. has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with  it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item  is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from . This means  with  and  gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch.In   does not increase the flinch chance of  or Razor Fang.In   does not affect the move .

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: makes any attack targeted at the ability-bearer - regardless of whether it hits - use 2 PP instead of 1.If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Supreme Overlord
abilities.description: Attack and Special Attack are boosted for each party Pokémon that has been defeated.

abilities.name: Ice Body
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  will recover  of its maximum HP during hail, after each turn. It also grants immunity to the hailstorm damage, if not already immune.

abilities.name: Thermal Exchange
abilities.description: Raises Attack when hit by a Fire-type move. Cannot be burned.

abilities.name: Rattled
abilities.description: When a Pokémon with  is hit by a ,  or  type move, its Speed is raised one stage (up to the usual maximum of +6 stages).

abilities.name: Good as Gold
abilities.description: Gives immunity to status moves.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  will use a  when its HP drops to 50%, rather than the usual 25%.Pinch berries are: Figy, Wiki, Mago, Aguav, Iapapa, Liechi, Ganlon, Salac, Petaya, Apicot, Lansat, Starf, Micle and Custap. (Their descriptions state that they work )

abilities.name: Heatproof
abilities.description: reduces the damage taken from -type moves by 50%. It also halves the damage from a burn, from  to  of the Pokémon's maximum HP.

abilities.name: Hospitality
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it showers its ally with hospitality, restoring a small amount of the ally's HP.

abilities.name: Stalwart
abilities.description: Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves.

abilities.name: Stamina
abilities.description: raises the bearer's Defense by one stage when it is attacked by any move.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

abilities.name: Sticky Hold
abilities.description: prevents held items from being taken or switched.If a Pokémon with  is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of hooking a Pokémon during fishing increases.

abilities.name: Regenerator
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  restores  of its maximum HP when switching out.

abilities.name: Supersweet Syrup
abilities.description: A sickly sweet scent spreads across the field the first time the Pokémon enters a battle, lowering the evasiveness of opposing Pokémon.
